meanings.definition: The actions or behaviors characteristic of a hoodlum.
meanings.sent1: The hoodlumisms of the troublemaker were causing chaos in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The police were trained to recognize the hoodlumisms of the criminals.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly referred to the students' mischievous behavior as hoodlumisms.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall was a clear display of hoodlumisms in the area.
meanings.sent5: The movie accurately portrayed the hoodlumisms of the gang members.

meanings.definition: The language or slang used by hoodlums.
meanings.sent1: The detective had to decipher the hoodlumisms in the gang's messages.
meanings.sent2: The book about street culture included a glossary of hoodlumisms.
meanings.sent3: The comedian imitated the hoodlumisms of the characters in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The writer captured the essence of the city's underworld with authentic hoodlumisms.
meanings.sent5: The teenager's speech was peppered with hoodlumisms picked up from the rough crowd.
